website_summaries.verdict: A lower-cost Sonicare toothbrush that promotes a thorough cleaning of each mouth quadrant.
pros: Toothbrush guards against "overbrushing" with pressure sensor
Two-week battery life before need for a recharge
cons: It does not have the varying intensities that some other Sonicare toothbrushes offer

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited, BUT
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase my first Sonicare, however, within only a few months of having it, it has already stopped working. I have tried new brush heads, of course, charging it, but the brush head replacement light continues to blink orange. Wont work. Out $40 on the toothbrush (that I used for three months) and another $20 on the brush head replacement pack I bought. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Ambeezy

customer_reviews.title: Almost the basic Sonicare I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The pressure sensor is an unnecessary and annoying gimmick. The brush head has a sharp piece of plastic from the molding process that scratches my lips and needs to be sanded off. The Sonicare ecosystem is so bloated with features, gimmicks and silly nomenclature that it is very confusing to shop for heads. Simplify and improve quality.
customer_reviews.author: tqroljoe

customer_reviews.title: I received the used item
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe that I received a used item, the box arrived in poor condition, looked very old, very terrible. I also found that there was an old label covered by the new one, which confirm my guess, it was indeed used...You know, it is toothbrush, the used toothbrush, I just wanted to throw it away!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack W Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Expensive toothbrush that doesn't last that much longer than a manual
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended a Sonicare toothbrush. I went through two of these. One bought at a big box store that lasted about 45 days before the motor gave out. I figured this was a fluke and returned it and bought one on Amazon that lasted about 100 days. It's past the return window now. I may try the more expensive version from a membership warehouse, but only because they have their own return policy outside the manufacturer that will let me return it if it also dies in six months.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: My toothbrush was a dud. I’ve had it since the end of March and it quit working the beginning of July, of course outside the return period. My previous Sonicare lasted years so I’m really disappointed to waste my money on one that only lasted a few months.
customer_reviews.author: anna marie frank

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: i bought this after having owned several Sonicare toothbrushes in the past. This one would not hold a charge and worked for only 2-3 days before it died on me. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Shaft feel off after 3 months use!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hello I make most of my purchases from Amazon, cannot beat their delivery and prices!! However with this toothbrush I am very unsatisfied!! I am not sure if I received a defective one but the shaft that the brush heads attach too comes off now. My children and I can no longer use the tooth brush, which only lasted 3 months after I gifted the family it for Christmas. Unfortunately the return window has closed and now we have a non working tooth brush and new heads that haven't even been used yet.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift for a very particular friend ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a very particular friend. It lives up to his high quality and cost conscious standards. Even months later, we are both still mentioning how impressed we are with this product (I had bought one for myself before getting his). I’ll never go back to a standard toothbrush! The battery life is impressive. I only charge mine every 4 to 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Anne L. Kouchoukos

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: First time buying electric tooth brush! And I am absolutely in love!!! Super good for the price. Very powerful, it let you know when the 2 minute is up! Also, the brush felt gentle on my gum. Felt super clean after every brush! I had to buy another one for my husband because he also in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Tran Tham

customer_reviews.title: Toothbrush Received was USED
customer_reviews.text: The product I received had clearly been USED. The box had previously been opened, and was resealed with scotch tape, the bristles on the head were worn with use, and the case that covers the head was filthy from water/toothpaste that had been left on the bristles. I immediately asked for a return and will purchase a new toothbrush elsewhere. If I could give zero stars on this review I would. That was disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just give it a solid week of use.
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow. I have used OralB for 5 years. Finally died and my dentist daughter bought this, and so did I. Yes, it takes some getting used to. It will splatter toothpaste out of you mouth unless you: >Keep your mouth closed. >Spit out the liquid that accumulates. >Use it in the shower. It makes your teeth rattle and tickles your tongue but it cleans. It has removed plaque build up from the first use. I routinely brush for 4-6 minutes and this is great. Just allow yourself time to adjust to the difference this high performance machine brings to your oral hygiene. Oh, and it holds enough charge that at 4 minutes/night I get almost 2 weeks between charges.
customer_reviews.author: FairhillResidentialSrvcs

customer_reviews.title: Did not last even 5 months :'( Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had this Philips Sonicare C2 toothbrush not longer than about 5 months and it's already showing defects :'( i took this toothbrush with me in a carrier recently on a trip and since then it's making this weird noise as captured in the video. Something inside got broken. I am so disappointed and feel frustrated as I really liked this product. I was using it for the first time and it won't last 5 months. I hope the seller will contact me and help me with customer service. I don't want to buy a new one. Help me get this fixed
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Good clean
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good. If you have a sonic care you know what they are like. They leave your teeth feeling smooth throughout the day. It's awful when I have to use a regular toothbrush and my teeth are gritty. It is pretty basic but it gets the job done extremely well. It comes with the prepgrammed adjustment mode. Which is good for new sonic care users as it blasts your teeth pretty hard. However for experienced users it felt weak for a week. But once it got to full action I was happy.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Simpler is sometimes better.
customer_reviews.text: This was a good replacement of my previous, more complex brush. I didn't need all those settings for daily brushings. I liked my old charging base, though, with two extra brush holding points. When more than one person used the same brush they help. I put the new brush on it. I think the base unit should be available separately.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Labowitz

customer_reviews.title: Photo misleading
customer_reviews.text: Want to point out that Amazon is misleading with the photo it’s using for this product. The photo shown is the 5100 series not the 4100, in case those of you thinking you were getting the nicer model with a case. Apart from that toothbrush works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Prae K.

customer_reviews.title: Connecting part loose causing brushing to be extremely loud
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 2 weeks and the metal part that allows the brush head to connect became loose with each use causing it to be extremely loud when brushing my teeth. It saddens me since I’ve had another sonicare electric toothbrush I love for years but was excited to upgrade. I bought a black version of this toothbrush for my bf and his still works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Joevany

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: working great so far! Feel my teeth get more clean,
customer_reviews.author: jmn27

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit and non-existent customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Have been a customer for 25 years. Service was outstanding. Now, after a defective unit I get countless run-a-rounds, obstacles, and still have no label for replacement. Sonicare went from great to disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Nittlion

customer_reviews.title: Finally got one!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to get a sonicare toothbrush for a long time now, I couldn’t pass up the discount. I bought the two colors they had for my husband and I. I had to go try it out as soon as it arrived. I am very impressed, my mouth feels dentist clean! The toothbrush comes with a little cover to shield the brush head from nasties. I’ll update if my husband doesn’t like his. Definitely make sure to register it on the Philips Sonicare website, it will get you an additional 6 months on top of the 2 year it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R.

customer_reviews.title: Broke just at 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Was great until broke after 3 months of use. See attached picture. We will see is seller responds and rectifies the defective product. I will re-post in 7-10 days if seller steps up and fixes the issue.
customer_reviews.author: hockeyman

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from my dentist after using this toothbrush for the past 6 months. My cleaning was the worst so far. Dental hygienist said there was more plaque than she’s seen in my previous check ups. And I usually have great reports on the condition of my teeth. I will not be using this again and try Oral-B like my hygienist suggested 6 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsay I.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in March and have been using 2-3 times daily. I just had my quarterly dental cleaning and they asked me what I was doing differently because my teeth were WORSE than they were the quarter before. This upset me very much and I am going to shelve this product and purchase another ORAL B which is what I had been using for the last 5 years. When it 'died' I decided to give this product a try as it was part of an Amazon Deal the day I was looking for a replacement. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: City Girl

customer_reviews.title: Only worked from 2 months..... :(
customer_reviews.text: I had a Sonicare toothbrush for years and it was always great. When it broke, I naturally ordered another one. I got it in September and by December it was non-functional. I noticed that the brush head was vibrating strangely and when I finished brushing I realized that the metal 'connector' was not attached firmly any more so the whole brush was wobbling. At that point, it no longer charged either. The toothbrush has never been anywhere other than sitting on my bathroom countertop so it has not had any 'wear and tear.'
customer_reviews.author: JSel

customer_reviews.title: Great Toothbrush, Forget the Gimmick
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement for a slightly different but similar model. The addition of a chip embedded brush head attachment to let you know when it's time to replace itself is wasteful. Let's call it what it is - a way for Philips to get you to buy official Philips brand brush heads. There are plenty of non-Philips brush heads available here on Amazon, and I've tried a few, and many of them are just as good as Philips. This is why they embedded a chip in theirs; to try to give you a reason to go Philips at an exorbitant cost. Anyway, forgetting that, the device itself is excellent. Only reducing a star for the gimmickry.
customer_reviews.author: IZ

customer_reviews.title: OK, but NOT as "premium but w/o unnecessary modes"
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but inferior to older Philips brushes, in at least 3 ways. 1. The top part has no broader soft plastic "skirt" for tighter attachment of "generic" brush heads: steel rod only. 2. The brush head that comes with it is inferior: more dull, and smaller in size vs. prior designs. 3. The brush is more slippery that my older ones (cheaper harder plastic). Philips now charges $146 for brushes like sold before for $60-70. I bought this one, but will look for a competition, next time.
customer_reviews.author: Experienced Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this toothbrush for four months and it no longer works. It vibrates fine until you put any pressure on it at all (for example by applying it to your teeth) then it cuts out. My old one lasted several years.
customer_reviews.author: Amedeo Avogadro

customer_reviews.title: Worthless, just buy a regular $2 toothbrush instead
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I don't know if we received a bad one but this one is horrible. We have owned Sonicate toothbrushes many times. In fact, I have one upstairs. This one is downstairs. It has no power, stops working for seconds at a time often during the 2 minutes. It really ends up acting like a regular toothbrush without any power to it. We have had this one for a little over a month. I would return it but it is outside the return window so I will have to buy a different brand. Worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Judith S.

customer_reviews.title: Electric is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first electric toothbrush I've ever used, besides an old Spinbrush which didn't even compare. I'm having a hard time getting used to the skull-rattling vibrations still, but there is no denying that it gets my teeth VERY clean! I have a problem with tartar buildup behind my bottom front teeth, and the Sonicare got rid of it all immediately. I don't feel like it gets my tongue as clean due to the small brush size, but I guess it's a tradeoff. My teeth are so clean, I don't know what my dental hygienist will have left to do the next time I visit!
customer_reviews.author: Risapea

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two - one still works, other doesn’t
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for myself and one for my husband. Mine works as expected (so far), but my husband’s brush head does not stay on anymore after less than 2 months. It slides on and off, and does not attach. I tried putting my brush head on his handle with the same results. His is also noticeably louder and less smooth. Mine works fine - I like the simplicity, and don’t need all the other bells and whistles that come with the higher priced models. Good product, if it works.
customer_reviews.author: J.O.

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing; bought as an extra
customer_reviews.text: Love my existing Sonicare and wanted a backup for when traveling! Very powerful nothing else compares. I tried getting a cheaper alternative company electronic toothbrush with even more supposed brushes per minute and when you apply pressure it just stopped. The sonicare I trust with my dental hygiene which is so important... not just for your smile but also for heart health and more... plaque can effect more than your mouth. Get this it’s worth it and will last :)
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bois

customer_reviews.title: Teeth Shattering
customer_reviews.text: This is more personal preference and I ended up going with the oral b, but the first time using sonicare was an extreme shock. The sound was overwhelming and the experience was too much. I felt like my whole head was shaking and felt like it would shatter my teeth. I definitely prefer the soft vibrations of oral b over the sonicare, but think it’s more preference.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had sonicare in the past but this was the first in this version. It worked fine until the last week when it started to make loud noises and barely run now. The brush is loose and it sounds like the inside mechanism is broken with sounds of probably parts banging around inside the handle. Waste of money. **Update** I contacted Phillips on their website and they are supposedly sending me a replacement. I needed to have the original receipt which fortunately was available on Amazon. The warranty is for two years and I had only had it a little over 3 months. We shall see how long the replacement lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: The vibration of the toothbrush felt like it could knock my teeth out. There were no speed adjustment settings on this model, so god forbid if you knicked a tooth with it. Also, if it touched anywhere else on the inside of your mouth/gums, it would tickle like crazy. So you have tooth pain, or mouth tickles to contend with at all times, unless your mouth is as big as that guy that can fit 5 billiard balls into it, so you don't have to worry about anything but the bristles hitting the tooth you want to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: All the basics...but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginners electric toothbrush. There are no real special features other than the brush head replacement indicator. No speed or sensitivity settings or high-tech bluetooth pairing features like the higher models. The vibration action is very strong and will surprise you if you are transitioning over from a manual brush. Charger works as it should. I would probably recommend either getting the model below this if you want a basic electric brush or the model higher if you want more advance features. This middle ground doesn't really stand out in the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Persaud

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting an electric toothbrush for awhile. Every time I decided to go for it, there were so many choices, I didn’t know which to get and ended up not buying one. Happened to look the other day and amazon had done a review of them:) This one was #2, and I chose it over #1 because it came in 2 colors. That’s the only reason why. I LOVE IT, it’s like having a professional cleaning 2-3x/day. Definitely does a way better job than a regular toothbrush. Was even charged right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: tony civitella

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush! I only wish I had it sooner surpases any other brand! Ive had them all
customer_reviews.text: Despite brushing and flossing daily I have issues with gum disease. I was using this new electric toothbrush and my gums are tighter, less red and much less teeth staining compared to previous electric toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: purchased April 2019. Stopped working May 2020
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had a Phillips Sonicare for years. I was borrowing his and decided it was time I needed my own base. I love the way the brush cleans and it worked great for exactly 1 year. 6 weeks ago, the base started losing charge very quickly. This was annoying but not horrible, so I continued using and charged more frequently. 3weeks ago the base stopped working altogether. It still turns on and off, but when you place brush on your teeth it is no longer vibrating correctly. I will purchase this same brand but from another site. Not sure if this version is knockoff or just the base model, but 1 year was a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Junk as soon as your warranty ends
customer_reviews.text: I hate these things. If they didn't clean your teeth so well, I wouldn't buy them. They work great until the warranty runs out, this is the fourth one I've bought in the last couple years. They give you a tongue cleaner but don't fall for it! Actually using this on your tongue like a regular toothbrush destroys it. The ring that surrounds the metal stub that the toothbrush head goes on will fail and become wobbly. When this happens all of the vibrations go into the handle and it's worthless. For as much as they cost, this seems like a design flaw. Even the more expensive ones fail this way.
customer_reviews.author: Sean F

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an electric tooth brush that wasnt expensive and had just the basic functions, nothing fancy. What I like about this toothbrush it was inexpensive, has one cleaning mode, a built-in timer pressure sensor, and it alerts you when brushing too hard. The BrushSync technology reminds you when brush head needs replaced, which is a great feature. The toothbrush has a long battery life and is approved by the American Dental Association. My teeth feel cleaner and I am very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: DENISE GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Will only last one year
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted roughly a year and then completely fell apart. None of the bases actually do anything. No vibrations, no ultrasonic cleaning. It makes a noise, but they are just regular tooth brushes now. Worked good for a year, but I expected more from a brand like sonicare.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B. Herndon

customer_reviews.title: A great way to dental health!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Sonicare toothbrush in 20 years and by far the best one yet. I read the reviews on it before buying and I'm thrilled with my purchase. The smaller brush head does a great job cleaning each tooth like a dental hygienist would and goes around the corners inside as well. My mouth has never felt cleaner. My dentist highly recommends Sonicare.
customer_reviews.author: Lollipop

customer_reviews.title: Dentist recommended
customer_reviews.text: This purchase replaced an older model that finally gave out. It's light weight and more compact than the old version but seems to work just as well. It seems the battery lasts longer between charges. I first got a Sonicare because my dentist recommended it years ago. It seems to work well. At my six-month cleanings, the hygienist has remarked that there is minimal plaque between my teeth and up against my gums, so it seems to do a good job. (Don't forget to floss - that is still important!)
customer_reviews.author: Lost in the 21st Century

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Multitasking Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ultrasonic toothbrush. It is excellent. Really is superior to manual brushes and normal vibrating brushes. I only have 2 negative items for this product. 1- it tickles my gums. 2- every morning I wake up and feel like I haven't rested well. Last night I figured it out. I awoke about 2am to the sounds of buzzing near me. Needless to say my wife now wants here own Sonicare toothbrush. Questions: does Sonicare make a quieter toothbrush? My wife would like too know if these come in different sizes and with different shaped heads instead of the brush replacements?
customer_reviews.author: Julie and Jamie

customer_reviews.title: It buzzes and gets my teeth clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my old sonicare with the god awful screw brush replacement heads finally crapped out, and I wanted a new one that was smaller and more manageable. This is much better than my old toothbrush and the brush head is actually not a bad size from what I was expecting. I normally have problems finding brushes small enough so that when I brush my teeth I’m not also brushing my gums and getting them all irritated. Long story short this toothbrush rocks
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Best Toothbrush EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toothbrush. My mouth has never felt cleaner! I used a traditional tooth brush before switching to and electric and I thought my mouth was in touch cleanliness. NOPE! I can’t use a traditional toothbrush after having this Sonicare. Like. Damn. It’s so nice. It had many options/settings and tells you when it needs to be recharged - which isn’t often, by the way. It’s battery life is AMAZING. Charge it before a trip and you won’t have to worry at all. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: WEAKER AND CHEAPER THAN PREVIOUS GENERATIONS
customer_reviews.text: This 4100 model has become much weaker than previous generations, or is a fake. I was using my gf's 4100 base (with my own brushhead (; ) for the past year. She purchased that unit over a year ago. As other reviews have mentioned, the original/real 4100 will vibrate your whole head it's so strong, leaving your teeth feeling so clean it's like you've just left the dentist. This unit on sale on Amazon right now IS NOT THAT. The feeling is weak and my teeth do not feel nearly as clean. The finish on the handle is also different, it weighs less, and feels cheaper. It's better than a standard toothbrush but not by much. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CWood

customer_reviews.title: Cleans teeth much better than a manual toothbrush.
customer_reviews.text: This Phillips Sonicare 4100 is my first rechargeable toothbrush. So far I like it. It seems to clean my teeth better. I also had a coffee stain on one tooth (which happens to be slightly crooked) and it removed the stain. My manual brush never could clean this well. I am pretty happy with this toothbrush. I also like the feature of when I apply too much pressure the vibration changes to alert you to apply less pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and affordable step up from standard electric, rotating head toothbrushes. The whole "sonic" angle seems to be legit, and my experience with this brush bears that out. I've been happy with the result. And the brush is functional and easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: I'm an oral surgeon - this is the brush for MOST people
customer_reviews.text: I've had the fancier versions that cost 4x as much, and the main brush mode is the exact same. The key features are the 2 minute timer (broken into 30-seconds per quadrant with vibration reminders) and the pressure alarm (it buzzes if you press to hard, which can abrade and damage your teeth). All of the other modes and features are just gimmicks for MOST patients, but perhaps people with periodontitis (advanced gum disease) and things like that might find other brushing/gum modes helpful. Bottom line: for the average patient, no reason to spend more than this price tag. Just get this and don't look back!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary D. Saltman

customer_reviews.title: Must have gotten a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: Started out perfect, mouth felt cleaner than it had in years. I had been using it for about two months when it started rattling violently when turned on. I reseated the head, but it rattles even without one on. Sounds like something in the body is loose, like a screw falling around the internals. So disappointing, I had a cheaper model before that lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: After 6yrs, my other Sonic care quit, so I ordered this one.. I have to say the new one does everything the previous one did but it just seems to be lighter, the plastic feels different than my old one.. it is noiser than the old one, the brush attachment seems to rattle more.. I do like the cordless charging... put it on the stand and let it charge.. over all it does was it's suppose to do..
customer_reviews.author: Ghost rider

customer_reviews.title: Product fails after 6 weeks use
customer_reviews.text: While I have had two previous Sonicare toothbrushes, each of which worked well for years, this one failed after just six weeks of use. The stem that the brush head mounts on has obviously broken loose internally as battery charges, motor runs, and brush handle vibrates vigorously, but brush head does not oscillate properly. Also, I can move the stem around manually through a much larger range of motion than expected. After reading a number of the negative responses here, I don't believe it is worth the time and effort and inconvenience to get a replacement, as failure mode seems common suggesting a design or manufacturing defect. Money is just lost. I guess it's time to consider Oral-B.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: I had a Phillips model electric toothbrush before that was great. It had 3 speeds. The battery finally died permanently so I bought a less expensive Phillips model. It vibrates too much where the brush attaches to the handle. Thinking I just needed a new brush,I swapped a new one. Nope it is the rod out of the handle that is not fitting snuggly in the brush slot - therefore it vibrates too much. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Talita

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my dentist. After getting my second deep gum cleaning (which is expensive and painful) my dentist recommended this toothbrush. It came as expected and works great. It tickled my gums at first. As in, I literally laughed out loud. But once my gums got used to it, it feels amazing. My teeth feel cleaner. The test will be in a few days when I go for a follow up appointment with my dentist. We will see if she notices a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from the Arm and Hammer Spinbrush. I was replacing the batteries every 2 weeks, and the vibration/spin would decrease throughout those 14 days. The Sonicare brush is hands down the best brush ever! It cleans so well and adjust its vibrations according to how hard you’re pressing. It has a charger stand that I keep it on until I’m going to use it again, and you don’t have to pack up the charger to go because the battery will last. The heads last so much longer, and I have braces and the heads are doing fine with the extra wearing down from braces. Overall this is a great brush and worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cleaning, but it spatters a LOT
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT electric toothbrush. I like the shape of the brush head, particularly. I like that it shuts off if you press too hard. It's very convenient and well designed, EXCEPT, it spatters a LOT when I brush my teeth. I have never had so much trouble. It splatters toothpaste foam all over my shirt, my sleeves, and all around my sink and mirror. That bothers me more than I would have thought it could. Maybe I am just an incompetent toothbrush user, and need lessons. But wow! Other than the splatter issue, this is a wonderful item. It does a great job cleaning my teeth. It recharges automatically on its stand.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: We both recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: Philips Sonicare ProtectiveClean 4100 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, Black HX6810/50 Both my husband and I are enjoying our new Philips Sonicare Rechargeable Electric Toothbrushes. We like that we get a long charge from them (around 2 weeks) and they make our teeth feel very fresh and clean. They are slim and don’t take up much space in the bathroom. My mouth creates a lot of plaque and the Sonicare is effective for removing the plaque, meaning less visits to the dentist. We really like the 2 minute timer which helps us to know when we have brushed our teeth the right amount of time. We both recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Janie Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well and quickly
customer_reviews.text: I like the color (seems silly but it matches my renovated bathroom). The head seems small (smaller than the knock-off replacement heads I also bought). The bristles are firm but not painful. I like that it beeps every 30s to tell me to move on to the other side of my mouth... again, something that I thought was not useful but I do tend to brush one side longer than the other. I have to say that the first time I used it, I almost cried. It wasn't painful but it was very unpleasant; the vibration brought tears to my eyes. Second time, not so much. Third time, no problems at all. I really hope that it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: No regrets buying the cheaper model
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd (4th?) Sonicare. Original one lasted for many years before the battery life was too low to continue, so I got a new one and went with one of the high end versions. The high end version died shortly before the warranty expired, and it was replaced quickly. That replacement died less than 2 years later, and I debated buying a high end version again, but decided to get this less expensive model. To me, my mouth feels just as clean (maybe even more so) than with the version that was more than 5x the price, and if it proves to be just as unreliable and die after 18 months, then I'll have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Does its job.. and does it well! I've been using mine in the shower (naughty, I know) but it hasn't affected its functionality at all. Cleans teeth effectively and efficiently. Gives you a handy little notification every time you're ready to move onto the next "quadrant" of your mouth (think about your mouth divided into 4 sections - left side bottom, right side bottom, etc.). If you came here looking for a low cost but quality electric toothbrush there is no need to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Slane

customer_reviews.title: I'm back with Sonicare for good
customer_reviews.text: I've used Sonicare tooth brushes in the past but decided to try two of its competitors over the past year, the Oral B "spinny" tooth brush and the Quip. Neither worked as well as Sonicare so I'm back. I'm diabetic so gum care is very important and this tooth brush is hands down better than the other two and does not irritate my gums. I brush twice a day and floss. I have zero issues with my teeth and gums or any bad breath using Sonicare. I'm back with Sonicare for good
customer_reviews.author: Joel C

customer_reviews.title: Sonicare 4100 broken within 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought sonicare Feb 2020, and already it is broken. The brush no longer remains seated on the power source.I understand there is a 24 mos warranty. Brush was used 2x a day with minimal paste. Removed brush to clean awa any paste and now the brush will no longer seat itself and remain in place. It comes off in my mouth. Need to return for another perhaps better sonic brush.
customer_reviews.author: Elouise

customer_reviews.title: I never thought it'd be worth the money. I'm a believer now
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a powerful toothbrush and my teeth feel much cleaner after each use. Puts the cheapo mechanical toothbrushes to shame. I don't think I'll ever go back to a normal toothbrush again. Haven't had a chance to test the battery life fully but if it's rated for 14 day battery that's more than enough for me. It's a bit large for a travel toothbrush but I'd never want to leave without it
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Bailey

customer_reviews.title: My first electric toothbrush, and I am happy.
customer_reviews.text: This was $60, and my dentist ..for years... has urged me to get a electric toothbrush. She approved this model and I was happy is was only $60. It functions fine. The color matched the picture. This model did not come with a travel case. It has cool features. It lets you know when to change quadrants in your mouth. There is a "too much" pressure warning, if you are a too hard brusher. It gradually increases its intensity over a few weeks period, for new users. Which I appreciated, me - being new to one, it was intense when I started. I think it does more functions too. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Cicon

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but......
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this toothbrush, you will receive an offer from Philips for another new toothbrush if you register on their site. After you bother to do that, it will tell you your first toothbrush is free... and here's the catch (lie) but you can't get it until you subscribe to buy toothbrushes from them by the month..... I will never recommend this toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills toothbrush for a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush head is more narrow than your typical toothbrush, which took a little getting used to, but after a few days, I prefer this over my previous one (you can reach the back teeth easier). Overall, it's a good no frills electric toothbrush for a fair price. Wish there was a way to control the intensity/speed though. It kind of flings toothpaste all over the place when you brush your front teeth, and makes a mess on the bathroom mirror. A traveling case would have been great too. There is a small plastic cover for the brush. But again, for the price, can't have it all! It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny W. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Dentist recommended this brand
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Oral B (which spins in a circle), but my dentist recently recommended the Philips Sonicare because it vibrates back and forth. My dentist is an incredibly nice person, so I have every reason to believe she was being honest and not paid by Philips or anything like that. I find that the 30 second interval marks are much more noticeable with the Sonicare than the Oral B. With the Sonicare I can feel and hear it. With the Oral B, it was really easy to miss the 30 second marks when listening to headphones. Side note: My dentist also told me that those water floss products are very ineffective in flossing and keeping your gums healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander John

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great! Cleans really well. Smooth vibrations. Not noisy or coarse. Also, can use certain non-philips brush heads. $ savings!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stream line shape.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. Lots of noise and vibration so I use my regular tooth brush on headache days. Base is small and doesn't take up valued bathroom counter space. Took me a while to get used to hand placement. I kept accidentally hitting the off button when brushing my teeth on my right side of my mouth...user error. I had purchased three and was holding on to one to give to my mother for her birthday which happened to fall on the very last day they would accept returns. She didn't want it so late that night I filed for a return and they honored the return with refund.
customer_reviews.author: Eaw

customer_reviews.title: Better numbers and easier cleaning at the dentist.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. The first is still going strong. Battery lasts forever on a charge. I worried about having nickel metal hydride batteries instead of lithium, but it hasn't been a problem. The old one is almost as good as the new one battery wise. Lasts weeks on a charge. Only charge it when it needs it and you will be happy. As I said, helped significantly with the dentist visits. Made life much better. Well designed and improved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This would be best for a very small child
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my adult furry teeth and it doesn't work. I'm very disappointed with its dinky size and lack of power. For years, I've used the heavier model, still sold for $39.00, but bought this model, thinking they will soon stop making the older model, and I won't be able to get replacement brushes. Less is not better. If only returns weren't so challenging.
customer_reviews.author: sam harrison

customer_reviews.title: Healthy teeth and gums.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Phillips Sonic I have owned. The first lasted over 10 years. My hygienists brags on how nice my teeth are each cleaning and when I was offered a free toothbrush at my last visit, I told her I use a sonic. She said “no wonder your teeth are so nice”. I highly recommend the Phillips Sonic. If I use a regular brush, my teeth do not feel clean.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Whoa
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness. My dental hygienist recommended this product after my last cleaning. The first couple of times i used it, not only did I think I was going to have every tooth fall out of my head...but 2 minutes took forever. Obviously, I have been brushing my teeth incorrectly for 64 years. 2 weeks alter...I can honestly say...I have adapted quite nicely to it..and hope it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Have been using sonicare for years. I was disappointed when my current handle would no longer take a charge after 5 years but this handle is better than the one it replaced. Same small size with additional features (pressure sensor and brush replacement indicator). I did not need all the modes offered on the more expensive Sonicare models. This one was less expensive than the model it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Low end model, just terrible
customer_reviews.text: We used a higher end FlexCare model for years... what a let down this one is. Light-weight, cheap feeling. Smooth exterior is easy to drop. Maybe they want it this way? The "Pressure Sensor" feature stops the action if you press too hard. Unfortunately it does this all the time while brushing. Ever time you change direction or get the back teeth etc. I think that is how they get away with using a cheap low-power vibrator "motor" inside, stop the action if you demand too much from it. Did I mention this thing feels light and cheap!! Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MY GUMS STOPPED BLEEDING!! This toothbrush is the best.
customer_reviews.text: After using this I realized that I used to be AFRAID of brushing my teeth because the softest bristles on normal toothbrushes poke my gums and make me bleed. This toothbrush doesn't, and it feels so good that I've been brushing after every meal. I know it's quarantine and that's probably a result of having nothing better to do, but I don't mind! I almost wish it came with a case to travel with (normally, I'd use a cheap travel toothbrush, but I can't now, I'm hooked on this :P)
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: invasion from outerspace
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth sonicare toothbrush I've owned. I've loved the others, but eventually the batteries died. This one has a strong battery, but it has a weird invasion from outerspace variable hum to it. I'm returning it in the hopes that it's a fluke, not the new Sonicare soundscape.
customer_reviews.author: Joane

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like it more
customer_reviews.text: The pressure sensor is an unnecessary and annoying gimmick. The brush head has a sharp piece of plastic from the molding process that scratches my lips and needs to be sanded off. The Sonicare ecosystem is so bloated with features, gimmicks and silly nomenclature that it is very confusing to shop for heads. Simplify and improve quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Literally the least of my worries
customer_reviews.text: I dunno. It’s a toothbrush. It works fine. What doesn’t work fine is our current system of government which encourages the hoarding of capital, and allows 3 people to have as much wealth as the bottom 50%. The toothbrush will help remove plaque from your teeth, which is important, but not as important as guaranteeing healthcare as a universal human right. I’d like to use this review to encourage you to please vote for Bernie Sanders
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months!!!!
customer_reviews.text: CON: Broke after 2 months of single person twice daily use. I ordered Sept 15, 2019. Nov 15 it was broken. The metal shaft that comes out became super loose. It vibrates like crazy, making loud noises. Nothing like when it was working properly the first 59 days I used it. Something definitely came undone inside. Pros: Teeth were cleanest they've ever been during those two months.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: OK but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a Diamond brand tooth brush. My error: I failed to notice that this black Philip's toothbrush was NOT what I was searching to buy. This seems to work OK but, of course my extra Diamond brushes do not fit. Although it works as advertised it feels cheaper and a bit smaller than my old Diamond it replaces. Battery life remains to be determined but for the first weeks it is GREAT! The mfg's box included significant divided separate space as if something was left out...but what was listed was included. Curious.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This was my electric toothbrush. I have had this for over a month. I had a lot of concerns around it being too hard on my teeth. All I can say now is that I wouldn’t go back to a regular toothbrush. This is far superior to manual brushing. I got this for my plaque build up - excessive coffee but it should work for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: VV

customer_reviews.title: Brushing Made Fun
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my hygienist, I never thought I would actually enjoy brushing my teeth. I love that it has a vibrating beep signal to tell you when to switch brushing another section of your mouth, making sure you are brushing evenly throughout. It turns off automatically after two minutes. I didn’t think to take this for traveling and took my manual toothbrush instead. Boy, do I brush hard because I was bleeding. At least with this electric toothbrush, it vibrates when I am brushing/pressing too hard - another great feature. I don’t leave it on the charger, which is okay because I only need to charge it once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Chenda

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: This was a total game changer for my mouth. The vibration is SO strong, I swear it makes my brain jiggle. Small price to pay for super clean teeth. It's water proof so I can bring it into the shower with me. The battery lasts about 2 weeks. It comes with the charger; a simple little stand that plugs in. It has a timer so you can be sure you're brushing long enough but to be honest, I let it run through twice because I love brushing with this thing. It's so satisfying. If you're debating on purchasing this for yourself or someone else, just do it. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Manual toothbrushes are better
customer_reviews.text: This looks really nice but I don’t feel like my teeth are getting clean enough compared to a manual toothbrush. The Brush head is also tiny - as if it’s meant for a child to use. I wish I could return this and get my $40 back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my sonicare since the battery would no longer hold a charge. I chose black so it didn’t show dirt like its white counterpart (no, I’m not cleaning toilets with it...it’s a guy thing). I like this version in that it warns you if you are pressing down too hard...a bad habit of mine. It also has the same feature of beeping to alert you that you’ve spent enough time on one area in case you’re a daydreamer. Sonicare is a great product that we’ve used for years and this model is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: AverageWhiteGuy

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: With so many reviews ill keep mine pretty short. My favorite and least favorite thing of the toothbrush is the brush head. Brush head good- The small size makes it easy to brush my wisdom teeth Brush head bad- The small size mean you dont feel like youre covering your teeth as well as you use to with older brushes. Everything else is just fine with the brush so far.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: great brush
customer_reviews.text: I looked at some other brushes that were twice as much and had a bunch of features i didn't need. this one works well and is simple. If you have a Costco Membership though buy this brush there, they have a two pack of them for the same price, plus the one they have there has a gum setting on it. My parents bough their set at Costco a couple months after i got mine....
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Not good for sensitive mouths/fair seller
customer_reviews.text: Tried this product since the reviews were good and I wanted a slim charging stand for my sink vanity. Toothbrush head is a bit thin, but the real issue for me is how powerful it is. Some would find this appealing, but it made my teeth ache. Also, the noise durinf has is so high pitched it sounds like you’re undergoing a cleaning at the dentists office. Very off putting. If you have any mouth sensitivity this brush is not for you. The seller was super accommodating so that’s the silver lining.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaH

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been my whole life, bought one for me and my husband and we both absolutely love this brush! You literally feel like you just got back from the dentist with a clean mouth. No grimy feeling all your teeth are smooth and polished, It did take a little getting use to since the first time it tickled the whole time and made my mouth all fuzzy feeling from the strong vibration but it works amazing and now that my mouth is use to is I will never go back! If you want a clean mouth buy this
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are great. I've tried a lot of different toothbrushes over the years and nothing cleans like a sonicare. I briefly switched to the quip toothbrush to try it out and came to find out that they are basically no better than a manual toothbrush. This toothbrush will give you the cleanest teeth you've ever had, get you compliments from your dentist, travel well on vacations, and stay charged so long you won't remember where you put the charger. Go ahead and add this toothbrush to your cart and say hello to whiter teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrush that I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. My teeth actually feel clean. Just like they feel after your dentist cleans them. Only have had toothbrush for a few days now but I actually enjoy brushing my teeth. Had a Oral B toothbrush before and the charging plate went out on it. Time for a new electric toothbrush. An upgrade I think. The toothbrush is not as heavy to handle as my old one, easier to maneuver. Not as rough on my gums. Seems to glide over them. A great brush and I love the pink color. Brush head comes with a cap.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing...
customer_reviews.text: I had a nicer model for many years and finally needed a new one. I thought I would try the ProtectiveClean 4100 since it is only $40. It is terrible and now I am going to buy a nicer one (again). The "sonic" action is basically just a loud, grating vibration. I have used throw away ones from the grocery that work better. Do yourself a favor and just get a nicer model.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Made my teeth hurt!!!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to turn in my old three-setting electric toothbrush for something new. Read overall positive reviews of this inexpensive brush and decided to give it a try. From the first, it felt too hard and abrasive, but I thought that I needed to give it more time. Doh! My teeth finally said, "Enough. We hurt!" This brush may work for you, but I plan to spend more money and go back to a three-setting brush.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi B.

customer_reviews.title: One time, and suddenly my teeth are actually clean!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a manual toothbrush for ten years now. I have decent brushing technique. Always good checkups. But one try of this, and my teeth are actually totally clean. Gums feel good too. The little bristles must work like little jackhammers, because my teeth don't feel rough anymore. If you press too hard, the sonicare lets you know by changing the pulse. I'm so glad I bought it. I had one as a child, and it was great, but in the years since, they've improved it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: writtenshadow

customer_reviews.title: Slippery Surface Makes it Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sonicare for years and loved it. But when I got this new one and tried it I found if difficult to grip because its plastic body is super slippery. My old one had a rubberized exterior that made it effortless to grip, whether your hand was dry or wet. This one lacks that rubberized feature (probably to save cost) and is a nuisance to hold - it twists in my hand when I don't want it to as I'm brushing. I will probably toss it get a different model.
customer_reviews.author: S. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 6 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the toothbrush did a good job with cleaning and reminding of too much pressure. But after only 6 weeks of using the toothbrush twice a day, it does not work as designed. The vibrating post that the toothbrush attaches to is now loose and moves haphazardly, and without proper movement, the toothbrush is useless. There is no fixing this problem, so the money spent on this product was wasted. Although I like electric toothbrushes and an older model I had was satisfactory, I would NOT recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: I missed the Sonicare!
customer_reviews.text: This model is recommended by shopping guides as the best model because of the price. Higher priced models have fancier battery gauges and some features that have not been proven to improve oral hygiene. Given that the batteries on all models are not replaceable, you may as well get the lower priced model. My last Sonicare died when the battery failed to charge, and my dentist sold me on an Oral-B electric toothbrush. I hated it. I'm really glad I have this one now.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Awesome electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: So I kept my old electric toothbrush too long. I knew I should have purchased a new one sooner but kept putting it off. You just never know if the next one will work as good as the old one. This one is even better than my old one. It vibrates so I do not feel like it's damaging my gums (I have receding gums) and it holds a charge for a very long time. I am very happy with my purchase! I would recommend it if you're looking for a good Electric toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally Clean Teeth !
customer_reviews.text: I was using either the oral b or spin brush from the drug stores for the last 18 years, or so. Finally broke down and bought the Sonicare 4100. Wow! Every time I brush my teeth, I feel I've seen the dental hygienist. The run time seems to be lasting, it takes up a small profile in the bathroom, the charger is very compact, the entire thing would easily pack for traveling. I like the feature of the timer for each quadrant of one's teeth. Yeah, very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

product_meta.title: Philips Sonicare HX6810/50 ProtectiveClean 4100 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Handle OnlyFeel the difference of a gentle clean with our pressure sensor while removing up to 7x more plaque than a manual toothbrush. Densely-packed, high-quality bristles remove up to 7x more plaque than a manual toothbrush. And the specially curved power Tip makes reaching the teeth at the back of your mouth a breeze. You can be sure of a safe brushing experience: Our sonic technology is suitable for use with braces, fillings, crowns, and veneers, and helps prevent cavities and improve Gum health. Our Quadpacer lets you know when you've spent just the right amount of time Cleaning Each part of your mouth, while our smarter tells you when you've brushed for the recommended two minutes.
feature_bullets: Gentle and effective care made easy with sonic technology that removes up to 7x more plaque vs. a manual toothbrush
Protect your teeth and gums with a pressure sensor that gently pulses to alert you when you're brushing too hard
Always know when to replace your brush head for an effective clean with the brush head replacement reminder. Pressure sensor Alerts when brushing too hard
2 minute timer with QuadPacer helps ensure Dental Professional recommended brushing time and a consistent clean throughout your mouth
Long lasting 14 days battery life. Battery indicator light lets you know when to recharge

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
